column4: hello everybody, since i updated to ubuntu 9.04 from kubuntu 8.10 I can not establish wifi-connection neither through networkmanager -genome nor through WICD. can someone help me out with this please.
is your wireless card being seen?
have you tried from the command line?
I don't use much wireless myself but I can try, give me a sec
what does iwconfig show you?
should be a few lines
ok, pastebin it :)
what kind of card is it?
ok but what adapter is it then?
no errors or messages while installing?
try sudo ifconfig wlan0 up or sudo dhclient wlan0
has the adapter ever worked before? do you have access to the router to see if MAC filtering has been enabled?
have you installed the wpa-supplicant?
what is the output of ndiswrapper -l
just open a terminal and paste that in
did you use the win XP driver or win2k?
try cleaning it all out and use the win2k driver ... if I remember right I had trouble with the xp driver on my laptop wireless but win2k worked perfect
will be here
how did you make out?
glad to hear you got it working :)
very welcome
